review_title: Great Place to work Fantastic leadership
job_title: Director of Food and Beverage Operations in East Lansing, MI
pros: Employees, Residents, location, and leadership
cons: Mostly positive and I have nothing negative to say

job_title: Executive Pastry Chef in East Lansing, MI
pros: Everyone is very nice and helpful. Good benefits and 401k!
cons: I drive an hour to work.

job_title: Recreation Assistant in East Lansing, MI
pros: I have been working for Burcham Hills for almost 2 years and have loved every minute here. The residents are wonderful, the food is fantastic and we are a great team that works together to meet resident needs. We have a variety of activities and events that all resident may attend.
cons: None that I can think of.

job_title: Director in East Lansing, MI
pros: I have been employees by Burcham Hills for over six years as the Director of the Burcham Hills Foundation. My position is part of the Burcham Leadership Team and I can truthfully say, we devote a large of amount of time exploring ways to steward the Burcham Hills staff. We understand the importance of caring for the entire Burcham HIlls Family, residents, resident families and staff.
cons: Working in health care during this time can be difficult at times.

job_title: Chef in East Lansing, MI
pros: I have been with the company for almost a month now. I have only but praise to say about the company. All the management teams have been so helpful and everyone is so positive and always greating you asking if there is anything they can do. Amazing company.
cons: None at the moment. Everything positive

review_title: good job i f you not in school or have no kids
job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in East Lansing, MI
pros: pay was pretty good co workers was okay but sneaky schedule
cons: mandated every other day switching floor’s management shows favoritism don’t care about personal life

job_title: Receptionist in East Lansing, MI
pros: Very friendly atmosphere and fun people to work with
cons: There are no cons working at Burcham

job_title: Anonymous Employee in East Lansing, MI
pros: I enjoyed my time there
cons: Office politics are too much sometimes

job_title: Concierge in East Lansing, MI
pros: Wonderful caring people, who strive to do their best.
cons: We are finding hard to find people who want to work.

job_title: Security Officer in East Lansing, MI
pros: Nice facility and staff. Always going the extra mile.
cons: none that I can think of at this time.

job_title: Director in East Lansing, MI
pros: Focused attention on employee satisfaction, workplace balance, etc.
cons: Normal challenges affecting all healthcare environments.

job_title: Director in Lansing, MI
pros: Burcham has an amazing HR team that supports employees and advocates for them in all situations. They find talent in the community and identify opportunities for growth and development. They also build relationships with the teams, which makes it easy to go to them for help.
cons: The high effort application process for entry level positions may be a deterrent for some.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in East Lansing, MI
pros: unit culture was supportive and created an environment that allowed growth in skills.
cons: Turn-over rate was horrible. Many times there was not another CNA scheduled to work another shift which caused someone to be mandated almost every shift.

job_title: Maintenance Manager in East Lansing, MI
pros: The pros of working at Burcham is the amazing employees you get to work with everyday.
cons: There are no cons working at Burcham!

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Lansing, MI
pros:
Great employees, everyone from housekeeping to nursing. 
Good food and giant portions. 
Beautiful grounds.
cons: The construction has taken out the flower garden and water area but I will look forward to seeing the new addition completed soon.

review_title: Good pay, not so good communication.
job_title: Registered Nurse in Lansing, MI
pros: Good pay and shift differentials.
cons:
Short on the floor training.
Little to no communication between management and staff.
Required training, but didn’t offer it.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in East Lansing, MI
pros: I enjoyed some of my coworkers
cons: This was an extremely stressful job and I often had to stay later than my shift because of understaffing.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in East Lansing, MI
pros: High pay and bonuses, good patient relationships
cons: No schedule flexibility, too many hours

job_title: Front Desk Receptionist in Lansing, MI
pros: Great coworkers and managers are supportive as they can be.
cons: HR is horrible and Directors do not care.

review_title: Excellent Place to Work- Great Teamwork!
job_title: Receptionist in East Lansing, MI
pros: Burcham Hills is a wonderful community to be a part of. I was hired about a year ago and was given excellent training. During my short time here, I have had the  opportunity to take on new positions. My supervisor is kind, receptive, supportive and has an 'open-door' to asking questions. I admire the leadership because they appreciate and recognize staff for their hard work. I believe the culture at Burcham Hills is resident focused, supportive, and committed to excellence. There are so many employees that have been here for 5,10, 15 and even 20+ years because it is great place to work. I would have stayed if I were not moving across the country.  I was so grateful to work with nursing, maintenance, hospitality, wellness ect. staff that were always willing to help me and each other out. I made good friends and will miss our awesome residents!
cons: The most challenging part of the job is watching family, friends, staff and loved ones cope with loss. However, I am grateful to work in a community where staff is able to support residents and their loved ones in such a way that I often hear ‘mom/dad loved this place and you all took such great care of them’.

review_title: Internal Employee Review of Burcham Hills
job_title: Anonymous Employee in East Lansing, MI
pros:
- The people at the community is what makes me get up and come to work everyday. 
-I enjoy my work. I have the opportunity to work in several departments 
-There is room for growth 
- I feel appreciated 
-It is a lot of fun, there are a lot of events for not just the residents for for the employees as well. 
-I get rewarded for the hard work that I have done
cons:
- The yearly raise went from 3% to 2% 
-Office employees cannot wear open toed shoes
- The insurance is not great but it is not too bad 
- The office space can be tight and noisy. It is hard when people are always walking into the office

job_title: Nurse
pros: Great team work. Everyone pitches in to help get the best care provided for our residents. The Administrator even helps out answering call bells and making beds. People have fun and enjoy interacting with one another. The management offers a lot of training opportunities to keep our skills at top notch. The 1st floor is modern and well run.
cons: I would like to work more hours, but I realize that it is necessary for the company to manage overtime.

review_title: Everyone can learn from clearing a table or two
job_title: Kitchen in East Lansing, MI
pros: The residents are great to work with
cons: Need more support from director. Do more then put a hair net on please.  It may look good to your boss, but really who are you kidding!

review_title: You would have a hard time finding a worse place to work.
job_title: Staff RN in Okemos, MI
pros: You really need a job and are willing to work anywhere at all.  You don't care about professional development or salary increases.
cons: The management has no appreciation of the staff.  The DON is a petty woman with anger management issues.  They seem to be either clueless or unconcerned at the terrible morale that is prevalent throughout the facility.  Mandation is out of control.  My manager knows less about nursing standards than I do, yet she insists on negating my orders and forcing me to implement hers.  I have never worked in a more poisonous environment.

job_title: Certified Nurse Assistant in East Lansing, MI
pros: Lots of open shifts to pick up when all beds are filled, great coworkers, just offered raises to entire workforce
cons: Expect no help from management. Managers harass employees instead of providing a solution. HR department is the same. If you have a compliant your concern will have already been twisted before you even enter the office. Huge divide between management and other staff. Zero flexibility in scheduling and refuses overtime. They will never do you a favor for a day off, but will ask you to pick up shifts constantly. Often times you will be short staffed. Preferential treatment males, especially male RNs. Management does not care about resident's mental well being. Purely a for profit environment.

job_title: Registered Nurse in East Lansing, MI
pros: Co-workers and residents. They were the best part of the job.
cons: There is a real loss of communication between management and employees. The management is top heavy, while not addressing the floor needs. The Director is not social and does not take the time to meet new staff.

review_title: Redeeming quality is the employees. I wish there was more.
job_title: Anonymous Employee in East Lansing, MI
pros: Co- workers (non-Management) are the hardest workers to have ever worked with. They really care about  the residents they take of.  The residents and their families are extremely grateful for the help.
cons: Management has no problem putting you in a compromising position to to save money. They work the staff short constantly. Management will strong arm you into taking on more responsibility than humanly possible (i.e. 60 Residents to 1 Caregiver). This can result in residents being neglected because the employees cant get to them in time. There have been many times that safety violations occur. Management has no problem promoting or demoting the employees to keep them in line.

job_title: Caregiver in East Lansing, MI
pros:
Residents are wonderful. Some coworkers are great to work with. Always a shift to pick up if you need some extra money.

Holiday pay is double which is nice.
cons: There is a specific CC who is the most unfriendly woman I have ever encountered. She shows blatant favoritism and I don't think i've ever seen her smile since I've been working here.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in East Lansing, MI
pros: Any time I have had a concern I brought it to managements attention and they followed up with it right away.  It's nice to be heard and get praise on a job well done.
cons: Their attendance policy is strict, I would look at easing up a little. Have a group session to discuss more about this.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in East Lansing, MI
pros: The people who need our care and  my fellow workers
cons: There are rumors that all the middle managers were forced to take big pay cuts but the leader didn't.  Seems unfair.  When is it gonna happen to us workers?

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant in East Lansing, MI
pros: Residents made this job enjoyable. Getting to help them everyday become more independent was what made the job worth it. Employees there are very friendly and helpful.
cons: Understaffed. Call lights were almost always on and it was near impossible to find time to chart before the end of the day ended.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in East Lansing, MI
pros: Supportive co-workers, good benefits, Room/opportunity for advancement,
cons: Large number of floor staff call in's which can be stressful on co-workers. Management is good at calling people to come in and work, but yes, mandating does have to happen. It is hard, but that is what happens when our fellow co-workers call in.

job_title: Registered Nurse in East Lansing, MI
pros: Many caring and compassionate direct care staff, hats off to you (you know who you are)
cons: Upper management had great ideas at times but would not follow through.  Staff cut to to "budget cuts" while other public curbside appearances are completed (remodeling, landscaping).

job_title: Certified Nurse Assistant in East Lansing, MI
pros: The residents, they are so appreciative and you just know that you're making a difference. Also, most of the coworkers! It's always about team work
cons: Under staffed, no consistent raises, and lack of direction sometimes by management as to what policies and procedures are. I witnessed s lot of people on their phone all the time at work

review_title: The HR is Over Bearing and Dictators
job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in East Lansing, MI
pros: Structured assignments, good work hours, free food
cons: Over competitive employees , unnecessary attitudes , HR Dictatorship

job_title: Customer Relations Representative in Lansing, MI
pros: The residents are great to work with .  Staff are very team oriented.
cons: Would like to see better insurance options

review_title: Burcham Hills the place to be.
